Terms.ShortDescription: a type of particle that consists of three quarks
Terms.LongDescription: A baryon is any particle that consists of exactly three quarks.

Terms.ShortDescription: any particle that has integer spin
Terms.LongDescription: A boson is any particle that has integer spin.

Terms.ShortDescription: any particle that has half-integer spin
Terms.LongDescription: A fermion is any particle that has half-integer spin.

Terms.ShortDescription: a type of particle that consists of two or more quarks or antiquarks
Terms.LongDescription: A hadron is any particle that consists of two or more quarks or antiquarks.

Terms.ShortDescription: a type of baryon that contains one or more strange quarks, but no charm, top, or bottom quarks
Terms.LongDescription: A hyperon is any baryon that contains one or more strange quarks, but no charm, top, or bottom quarks.

Terms.ShortDescription: a type of particle that consists of one quark and one antiquark
Terms.LongDescription: A meson is any particle that consists of one quark and one antiquark.

Terms.ShortDescription: a massless, electrically neutral particle that mediates the electromagnetic interaction
Terms.LongDescription: The photon is a massless, electrically neutral particle that mediates the electromagnetic interaction.
Terms.Etymology: from Greek photo-, combining form of phos, meaning 'light', and -on, the suffix for particle names
